job_description:
• Ensure timely delivery of high-quality reticles to all global fabs, meeting both technical and logistical requirements.
• Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Physics, Materials Science, or a related field, or equivalent experience.
• Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with attention to detail.
• Master’s degree or equivalent experience in a relevant technical field.
• Experience in semiconductor manufacturing or mask/reticle engineering.
• Experience with global fab operations and reticle logistics.
• Familiarity with automation tools and data analysis software used in mask engineering.
• Global Quality Process Control System (PCS) Senior EngineerBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 12 days ago Intern - Metrology Process Development EngineerBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted a month ago Principal Process Engineer, APTD BondingBoise, Idaho, United States of AmericaPosted 16 days ago.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
• The ideal candidate will have experience in Microchip firmware (MPLAB, Harmony), embedded Linux (ARM SoCs, Quartus), C++ GUI development with Qt, and networking (TCP/UDP).
• You'll translate customer needs into technical solutions and support project development end-to-end.
• Security clearance eligibility required (DoD preferred).
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to meet software engineering requirements.
